page.title: 09Glassworks in a Castle
page.content: 9 months ago Robert Martin and Ian Yeates started a glassworks in the grounds of Corby Castle. They use their skill to make a range of glass ornaments such as paper weights,perfume bottles and vases. They said that the methods they used(using molten glass,blowing irons and hand tools) are similar to those used 6000 years ago.The glass is heated and gathered on a blowing horn. It is then shaped by blowing through the tube and swinging and spinning by the blower who sits on his chair to do this.He is called "The Gaffer"and he sits in "The Chair." The furnace which is heated to 1000 degrees C.is never allowed to go out. It is a gas fired furnace and it takes 5 days to heat up and 5 days to cool down.The gas bill is Â£1000 a quarter. They make about 25 items each day.
